arm_group.description: 6MWT with the preferred music of the child

brief_summary.textblock:
To evaluate the effect of different distractive auditory stimuli (fast, slow and preferred)
      on 6 Minute Walking Test (6MWT) and the measured parameters (dyspnea, heart rate, oxygen
      saturation) in healthy children.

clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Music on 6 Minutes Walking Distance in Healthy Children

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  the participation to the physical education program after the annual medical
             investigation

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  a lung disease

          -  an overweight

          -  a motor disability based on parent's answers to a questionnaire

intervention.other_name: Listening to fast music during the test
Listening to preferred music during the 6MWT
Listening to preferred music during the 6MWT

clinical_study.official_title: Influence of a Distractive Auditory Stimulus on 6 Minute Walking Test in Healthy Children

other_outcome.description: Heart rate and oxygen saturation are measured before and after the test
other_outcome.time_frame: at the begining and the end of the 6MWT

primary_outcome.description: The distance walked by subjects during a 6 minutes walking test

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

secondary_outcome.description: Dyspnea is measured by a visual analogue scale

clinical_study.source: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

lead_sponsor.agency: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
